response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age", "high", "At 19 years old, the individual is in a high-risk age group for recidivism, as younger offenders statistically tend to reoffend more frequently."],
    ["Gender", "high", "Being male is associated with a higher risk of recidivism based on historical data on offending patterns."],
    ["Race", "medium", "Identifying as Black may increase exposure to systemic factors and biases that could affect recidivism risk, though it is not a deterministic factor."],
    ["Arrest History", "low", "Having only one arrest with no conviction suggests a relatively lower criminal history risk factor."],
    ["Education", "high", "Lack of a high school diploma or GED is a strong risk factor, as lower educational attainment is closely linked with higher recidivism."],
    ["Employment", "high", "Not having held any job during the year indicates economic instability and fewer social bonds, increasing recidivism risk."],
    ["Residence Status", "medium", "Living alone, without familial support, may contribute to social isolation and is a moderate risk factor for recidivism."],
    ["Drug Use", "low", "The absence of drug use in the past four years is a protective factor against recidivism."],
    ["Mental Health", "low", "Not experiencing depression recently indicates stable mental health, which reduces risk."],
    ["Family Background", "medium", "Growing up in an urban household of five can expose one to higher crime rates, posing a moderate risk factor."],
    ["Religiosity", "medium", "The belief that God has nothing to do with personal outcomes may reduce community and moral support, constituting a moderate risk factor."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 70
}

risk_factors: At 19 years old, the individual is in a high-risk age group for recidivism, as younger offenders statistically tend to reoffend more frequently.
Being male is associated with a higher risk of recidivism based on historical data on offending patterns.
Identifying as Black may increase exposure to systemic factors and biases that could affect recidivism risk, though it is not a deterministic factor.
Having only one arrest with no conviction suggests a relatively lower criminal history risk factor.
Lack of a high school diploma or GED is a strong risk factor, as lower educational attainment is closely linked with higher recidivism.
Not having held any job during the year indicates economic instability and fewer social bonds, increasing recidivism risk.
Living alone, without familial support, may contribute to social isolation and is a moderate risk factor for recidivism.
The absence of drug use in the past four years is a protective factor against recidivism.
Not experiencing depression recently indicates stable mental health, which reduces risk.
Growing up in an urban household of five can expose one to higher crime rates, posing a moderate risk factor.
The belief that God has nothing to do with personal outcomes may reduce community and moral support, constituting a moderate risk factor.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 19-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 1 time but has not been convicted. He is 5 feet 5 inches and weighs 135 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He does not have a high school diploma or GED certificate and is not enrolled in college. He has held no jobs during the year. He has not used any drugs in the past four years and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 5, in an urban area. He considers that God has nothing to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
